source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Loranthaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Loranthaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Anthers 1–1.5 mm long; leaves oblong to orbicular, usually less than 8 cm long, apex rounded, more or less penninerved; stems erect or spreading; host usually not a species of Eucalyptus

Anthers 2–2.5 mm long; leaves linear to lanceolate or oblong, usually more than 8 cm long, apex acute, more or less curvinerved; stems pendulous; host in nature usually a species of Eucalyptus (but also parasitizing a wide range of cultivated exotic trees and shrubs)
